intro: Psychotria mogandjensis, commonly known as the Congo Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental or medicinal value. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and usually have a distinctive coloration, ranging from white to purple. Psychotria mogandjensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
